isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 2000, 4000, 8000 - LIGHT SYSTEMS - DESCRIPTION - Headlight System

svcproc.title: Headlight System
svcproc.para: The headlight system consists of headlights, headlight switch, dimmer switch and Day Time running lights (mandatory for Canada, optional for USA). The fender mounted hea dlights are a two lamp system and share a molded cavity with the turn signals which is sealed from road spray and debris. The headlight switch is a 3-position (off/parking lights/headlights) rocker type located on the instrument panel.

The dimmer switch is either turn signal or floor mounted and when the turn signal stalk or the floor button is "clicked," the headlights will switch to either the hi-beam or low-beam position. When "clicked" again, the headlights will return to their original position.
The headlight lift-to-dim on the turn signal will operate the lift-to-dim relay when the headlight switch is in headlight on or park light on positions.
Trucks built between October 1, 1998 and March 16, 1999, without the new route for the headlight lift-to-dim relay circuit refer to CTS-5122V.

The Day Time Running light feature allows the vehicle to operate in a "lights on" condition at all times without driver input. This system operates the headlights at partial illumination but still helps to increase visibility even in bright sunshine.
